artist: Attributed to John Burgess Jr.; Formerly attributed to George Townley Stubbs
provenance: Joe McCrindle; Sotheby's, August 1, 1962, no.16; Henfield Foundation, London; given to MIA, 1963.
text:
At the end of a day of fishing, the catch is being loaded into a horse-drawn cart. One man lies down next to a beast that may have been used to pull boats onto the shore. Two small groups of women sit mending the nets. Behind them rises a cliff whose crags seem to have fascinated the artist.

John Burgess, Jr. was born into an artistic family. His mother was a sculptor, and his father, a watercolorist. If this is indeed his work, it remains difficult to localize the view since he travelled extensively in Britain and France.
title: Coastal Scene with Boats and Fishermen
